meta.title: Dokos — One App. 30+ Formats. Infinite Possibilities.
meta.description: Dokos is a native desktop document reader for developers. 24 specialized viewers for 50+ formats: Markdown with LaTeX and Mermaid, JSON, YAML, CSV, PDF, LaTeX, Org, AsciiDoc, Jupyter Notebooks and more. Built with Tauri 2 and Rust.

hero.subtitle: The high-performance reader for developers. Edit Markdown, visualize JSON, and diff code instantly without the bloat of an IDE.

formats.heading: Native Support for 50+ Formats
formats.subheading: No plugins required. It just works.

visualFeatures.mermaidDesc: Render flowcharts and sequence diagrams inline.
visualFeatures.latexDesc: Beautiful math typesetting for technical papers.
visualFeatures.jsonGraphDesc: Interactive node graph for nested data structures.
visualFeatures.csvPowerTableDesc: Sort, filter, and search large datasets easily.
visualFeatures.swaggerUiDesc: Test APIs directly from your documentation.

multitasking.heading: Built for Multitasking
multitasking.tabsDesc: Keep 20+ files open without losing context. Drag and drop to split views horizontally or vertically.
multitasking.searchDesc: Instantly find any string across all open files and projects. Regex supported.
multitasking.sessionsDesc: Close the app and pick up exactly where you left off. Your workspace is always saved.

profiles.heading: Who is Dokos for?
profiles.developersDesc: Quickly read code snippets, review PRs locally, and edit config files without launching a heavy IDE.
profiles.devopsDesc: Visualize Kubernetes YAMLs, diff server configs, and parse massive log files instantly.
profiles.writersDesc: Focus on writing with a distraction-free Markdown editor that handles math and diagrams perfectly.
profiles.dataDesc: Preview Jupyter notebooks, CSV datasets, and JSON outputs without spinning up a local server.

performance.heading: Native Performance.
performance.description: Built with Tauri 2 and Rust, Dokos uses a fraction of the memory of Electron apps. It's security-first, blazing fast, and respects your battery life.

ctaFinal.availableFor: Available for macOS, Windows, and Linux.

viewers.heading: 24 Specialized Native Viewers
viewers.subheading: Each file type gets its own optimized viewer — not just syntax highlighting, but a purpose-built interface.
viewers.markdownDesc: GitHub Flavored Markdown with LaTeX formulas, Mermaid diagrams, alerts, table of contents, and live split editing.
viewers.pdfDesc: Page navigation, Ctrl+Scroll zoom, keyboard shortcuts, and smooth rendering for any document size.
viewers.epubDesc: Chapter navigation, sidebar table of contents, and adjustable font size for comfortable e-book reading.
viewers.htmlDesc: Live preview, source code view, and split mode to see rendered output alongside your markup.
viewers.imageDesc: View PNG, JPG, GIF, WebP, BMP, and ICO files with zoom and full-screen support.
viewers.svgDesc: Preview with zoom/pan, interchangeable backgrounds (grid, light, dark), and full-screen viewer.
viewers.jsonDesc: Three view modes — collapsible tree, interactive graph, and raw — to explore any JSON structure.
viewers.yamlDesc: Collapsible tree, interactive graph, and raw modes. The same power as JSON Viewer, for YAML files.
viewers.tomlDesc: Tree, graph, and raw views for TOML configuration files with collapsible sections.
viewers.iniDesc: Structured view for INI, .cfg, .conf, and .ovpn files with section-based collapsible navigation.
viewers.csvDesc: Interactive table with fixed headers, sortable columns, and filters for efficient data exploration.
viewers.tsvDesc: Same powerful table as CSV Viewer, optimized for tab-separated files.
viewers.notebookDesc: Render Jupyter Notebooks with code cells, highlighted syntax, rendered outputs, and image support.
viewers.openapiDesc: Swagger UI-style interface with endpoints, parameters, schemas, and auto-generated examples.
viewers.logDesc: Color-coded by severity (Error, Warn, Info, Debug), filterable by level, with auto-scroll support.
viewers.diffDesc: Side-by-side or inline comparison of any two files. Select from the file tree and compare instantly.
viewers.codeDesc: Monaco-powered viewer with syntax highlighting for 15+ programming languages, DNS zones, Terraform, and plain text.
viewers.subtitleDesc: Dedicated viewer for subtitle files with format-specific parsers. Table view with index, timestamps, and text for SRT, VTT, ASS/SSA, and SUB formats.
viewers.patchDesc: Color-coded unified diff viewer with additions in green, deletions in red, collapsible file sections, and line numbers for both files.
viewers.texDesc: Render LaTeX documents with KaTeX math formulas (inline and block), headings, text formatting, and reference resolution.
viewers.bibDesc: Structured BibTeX viewer with sortable table showing type, key, title, author, and year. Expandable rows for all entry fields.
viewers.orgDesc: Emacs Org-mode renderer with headings, TODO states, priorities, code blocks, tables, property drawers, and inline formatting.
viewers.asciidocDesc: AsciiDoc renderer with headings, admonitions (NOTE, TIP, WARNING), code blocks with language labels, tables, and blockquotes.
viewers.rstDesc: RST renderer with heading detection, directives (code-block, note, warning), roles, links, and image/figure support.

featuresSection.heading: Features That Make the Difference
featuresSection.subheading: Discover what makes Dokos unique and why each feature was designed with you in mind.
featuresSection.diffDesc: Built-in diff with side-by-side or inline view. Select two files from the tree and compare them instantly, no external tools needed.
featuresSection.diffWhy: Spot changes between config versions, code, or documentation in seconds. Perfect for reviewing PRs locally or validating changes before a deploy.
featuresSection.monacoDesc: The same editing engine that powers VS Code: syntax highlighting, keyboard shortcuts, autocomplete, minimap, line numbers, and smart autosave.
featuresSection.monacoWhy: Edit your files with the same power and familiarity of VS Code, without the overhead of a full IDE. Perfect for quick config or documentation changes.
featuresSection.searchDesc: Search any text across your entire project with Ctrl+Shift+F. Supports regex, extension filters, and folder filters for precise results.
featuresSection.searchWhy: Find what you need instantly, no matter how many files it's spread across. Save minutes of manual navigation in large projects.
featuresSection.archivesDesc: Open ZIP, tar.gz, and tar.bz2 files directly in the file tree. Browse their contents like a regular folder, no extraction needed.
featuresSection.archivesWhy: Inspect package contents, backups, or build artifacts without cluttering your disk. Navigate inside compressed files as smoothly as regular folders.
featuresSection.sessionsDesc: Close Dokos and when you return, your tabs, active file, and expanded folders are restored. Your workspace always waits for you exactly as you left it.
featuresSection.sessionsWhy: Never lose your work context. No more remembering which files you had open or reconfiguring your workspace every time you launch the app.

comparison.subheading: Every task that requires opening another app today, Dokos handles natively.
comparison.summaryWithout: apps you need to open, install, and keep updated
comparison.summaryWith: native app, lightweight, all built-in, zero plugins

footer.privacyIntro: At Dokos, your privacy matters. This policy explains how we handle your data when you use our application.
footer.privacyDataContent: Dokos is a local-first application. Your files are processed entirely on your device. We do not collect, transmit, or store any of your documents or personal data on our servers.
footer.privacyStorageContent: All preferences and settings are stored locally on your device. We do not use cookies or tracking technologies within the application.
footer.privacyContactContent: If you have any questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at hello@dokos.app.
footer.termsIntro: By using Dokos, you agree to the following terms and conditions.
footer.termsUsageContent: Dokos is provided for personal and commercial use. You may install and use it on any number of devices you own.
footer.termsLiabilityContent: Dokos is provided "as is" without warranty of any kind. We are not liable for any damages arising from the use of the application.
footer.termsChangesContent: We reserve the right to update these terms at any time. Continued use of Dokos constitutes acceptance of any changes.
